level.text: An application for an order or other relief shall be made by filing a written motion; provided, that motions may be made orally at a hearing.
Written motions may be filed at any time unless the time for filing is specifically prescribed by the provisions of the Act or this subtitle.
Any party may file a response in opposition to a motion within five (5) days after service of the motion.
The Commission may schedule any motion for an oral hearing, or may decide any motion without a hearing.
Motions for expedited hearings or other forms of expedited relief shall be acted upon promptly.
The Commission may create a motions calendar to expedite resolution of motions, and may assign a Commissioner to dispose of motions.
